bug.author: carmine
bug.summary: profiles-deployment log error - "Error from server (BadRequest): a container name must be specified"
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened:
I followed the install instructions for existing kubernetes cluster - https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/ I waited until all pods are running I access the kubeflow dashboard, and there are no profiles (I have created one) I can't create a jupyter server (no dashboard).
When I look at the logfile for profiles-deployment, I see this error message: <denchmark-code>Error from server (BadRequest): a container name must be specified for pod profiles-deployment-9885b4dbd-4r2wn, choose one of: [manager kfam] </denchmark-code>
What did you expect to happen: I expected the profile/namespace to show up Environment:
Kubeflow version: 0.6.1 .. but the dashboard says 'build version v0.6.0-rc.0' kfctl version: kfctl v0.6.1-rc.2-1-g3a37cbc6 Kubernetes platform: microk8s Kubernetes version: 1.15.2 OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): ubuntu 18.04

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.99. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

The error you pasted is a bug in your kubectl logs command; you need to specify the container you are getting the logs for. Can you try running <denchmark-code>kubectl get profiles </denchmark-code>
What does no jupyter dashboard mean? Can you run kubectl -n kubeflow get deploy and verify the jupyter web app is running

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> - I'll run through the steps again on 0.6.2 that was just released. returned a profile I created after install. What I meant to say about can't create jupyter server ... is there is no namespace. Without a namespace, the required namespace fields can't be filled in.
Closing this issue .. the new 0.6.2 release seems to resolve the issue. I can see namespaces and I can create a jupyter server.
